channel.title: Central America – StefanCarlton.net
channel.description: my little place on the web

item.title: A catch up post (Copan, Volcanos, Kayaking, Tikal, Semuc Champey, The Blue Hole, Belize Independence Day, Coco Bongos)
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: Hmm, it appears that I’ve neglected the blog somewhat! I’m currently sitting in San Francisco and the blog still thinks I’m in Rio Dulce in Guatemala! It’s easy to see why I’m behind – I’ve been having too much fun to sit down and write about things! To catch myself back up, I figured I’d […]

item.title: Life after Utila – Rio Dulce
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: After enjoying life in Utila for much longer than I had previously envisaged I needed to be making tracks if I was to have any time to spend in Guatemala. So, still drunk from the night before and lacking any sleep I boarded the 6am ferry aiming for the mainland with a destination in mind […]

item.title: Learning to Scuba dive in Utila with Parrots Dive Center
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: This post is about possibly the finest week of my trip so far. It’s about finding a new love. It’s about meeting some amazing people. It’s about getting seduced by a way of life. It’s about potentially finding a new direction of career. It’s about nine days of near perfection. It’s also nigh on to be impossible to write about and convey just how great my time in Utila was but I'll try anyway!

item.title: Estelli and Somoto
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: I wanted to visit the two working towns of Nicaragua, Montagalpa and Estelli in Nicaragua but a change of plans meant I moved quickly through from Leon to Estelli and then into Somoto canyon. Estelli seemed nice enough for the evening I was there as there was a party in the street and a impromptu […]

item.title: Volcano Boarding, Leon
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: Many moons ago I was desperate to go Sand boarding in Ica, Peru but the protests at the border and the necessity of a flight from La Paz to Lima meant I missed the opportunity so I ensured I didn’t miss out on Volcano Boarding in Leon! I’d known about Volcano boarding for years as […]

item.title: Random happenings in Leon
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: I was told that Leon was meant to be a really pretty city but I found it to be a bit of a dump. I arrived and started walking down to the hostel and managed to get half-way before the heavens opened and I had to called it a day and hail a taxi. After […]

item.title: Masaya market
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: On my last day in San Juan Del Sur I fell in the sea and hit my left foot against some rocks badly scrapping the top. It was fine at the time but after the humidity and dampness of Volcano climbing in Isla De Omtempe, it had become infected and was weeping constantly, I thus […]

item.title: Hiking my first volcano – Madera, Isla De Ometepe
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: I’ve always wanted to hike and play on a Volcano and on Isla De Ometepe I had my first chance. A group was going the following day so we decided to climb Madera as it’s the easier climb but it’s still quite brutal! We started at lake level (which is pretty much sea level) and […]

item.title: San Juan Del Sur
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: San Juan Del Sur is just like Bocas Del Toro, except a bit cheaper and nastier. The sand is Volcanic so is a dirty grey rather than a crisp white and the whole town feels, well, cheap. I arrived with Chance and Alexandra and we took a cheap hostel towards the back of town, had […]

item.title: Getting through Costa Rica
item.dc:creator: Stefan
item.description: After leaving Bocas Del Toro, Nick and I were both headed to San Jose so took the ferry back off the islands and onto the mainland. A bus later we arrived in Changuinola and waited for our bus to San Jose. It was a doddle to do – we just jumped on board it took […]
